attributes.text:
Rich text editor widget which encapsulates the low-level {@link qx.bom.htmlarea.HtmlArea} component to offer editing features.

Optimized for the use at a RIA.
Optional style information for the editor’s document Can be a string or a map (example: { “p” : “padding:2px” }
This event is dispatched when the editor gets a right click.

This event holds a data map which informs about the formatting at the current cursor position. It holds the following keys:

  • bold
  • italic
  • underline
  • strikethrough
  • fontSize
  • fontFamily
  • insertUnorderedList
  • insertOrderedList
  • justifyLeft
  • justifyCenter
  • justifyRight
  • justifyFull

This map can be used to control/update a toolbar states.
This event is dispatched when the editor gets the focus and his own handling is done
This event is dispatched when the document receives an “focusout” event
Thrown when the editor gets an error at loading time.
Only available if messengerMode is active. This event returns the current content of the editor.
This event is dispatched when the editor is ready to use
This event is dispatched when the editor is ready to use after it was re-located and re-initialized. Only implemented for Gecko browsers.

Holds information about the state of undo/redo Keys are “undo” and “redo”. Possible values are 0 and -1 to stay in sync with the kind the “cursorContext” event works. (1 = active/pressed, 0 = possible/not pressed, -1 = disabled)
Checks if the given node is a block node
Checks if one element is in the list of elements that are allowed to contain a paragraph in HTML
Applies the postponed properties to the editor component
Clones the incoming data event and fires it at itself to let the application developers listen to the widget instance.
Clones the incoming event and fires it at itself to let the application developers listen to the widget instance.
Setup listeners for events of the low-level editing component and fires them at the editing widget.
Setup the low-level editor component and the listener delegate methods.

Listens to DOM changes of the container element to get informed when the HtmlArea is moved to another container.

This method is only implemented for Gecko browsers.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property contentType.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Creates

element which is aligned over iframe node to avoid losing mouse events.
Initializes the blocker element if (yet) not available
Cover the iframe with a transparent blocker div element. This prevents mouse or key events to be handled by the iframe. To release the blocker use {@link #release}.
Helper function to examine if HTMLArea is empty, except for place holder(s) needed by some browsers.
True, if area is empty – otherwise false.
Forces the htmlArea to reset the document editable. This method can be useful (especially for Gecko) whenever the HtmlArea was hidden and gets visible again.
manager instance or null if the editor is not initialized
Returns the complete content of the editor
complete content or null if the editor is not initialized
whether the html encoding of text nodes should be skipped

Getting the computed value of the editor. This method returns the current value of the editor traversing the elements below the body element. With this method you always get the current value, but it is much more expensive. So use it carefully.
computed value of the editor or null if the editor is not initialized

Returns the (computed) value of the property contentType.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.
Returns the information about the current context (focusNode). It’s a map with information about “bold”, “italic”, “underline”, etc.
formatting information about the focusNode or null if not initialized

Returns the (computed) value of the property defaultFontFamily.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property defaultFontSize.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontSize}.
Whether the document is in editable mode
Returns the node where the selection ends
focus node or null if not initialized
whether the html encoding of text nodes should be skipped
current content of the editor as XHTML or null if not initialized
Returns the iframe object which is used to render the content
iframe DOM element or null if the editor is not initialized

Returns the (computed) value of the property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property insertParagraphOnLinebreak.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property messengerMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property postProcess.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #postProcess}.
Returns the range of the current selection
Range object or null if not initialized
Returns the content of the actual range as text
selected text or null if not initialized
Selected plain text or null if not initialized.
Selection object or null if not initialized.
*** IN DEVELOPMENT! *** Returns all text nodes

Returns the (computed) value of the property useUndoRedo.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.

Getting the value of the editor. Attention: The content of the editor is synced at focus/blur events, but not on every input. This method is not delivering the current content in a stable manner. To get the current value of the editor use the {@link #getComputedValue} method instead.
value of the editor or null if it’s not initialized
the node element where the text should be retrieved from.
Returns all the words that are contained in a node.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property contentType with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property defaultFontFamily with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Inserts html content on the current selection

Removes all formatting styles on the current selection content

Resets the user value of the property contentType.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Safes the current range to let the next command operate on this range. Currently only interesting for IE browsers, since they loose the range / selection whenever an element is clicked which need to have a focus (e.g. a textfield widget).

NOTE: the next executed command will reset this range.
Sets the background color of the editor
url of the background image to set
repeat mode. Possible values are “repeat|repeat-x|repeat-y|no-repeat”. Default value is “no-repeat”

Position of the background image. Possible values are ”|top|bottom|center|left|right|right top|left top|left bottom|right bottom” or an array consisting of two values for x and y coordinate. Both values have to define the unit e.g. “px” or ”%”. Default value is “top”
Sets the current selection content to bold font style

Sets the user value of the property contentType.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Selected content type. Currently only XHTML is supported.
Default font family to use when e.g. user removes all content
Default font family to use when e.g. user removes all content
If true we add a linebreak after control+enter
Toggles whether a p element is inserted on each line break or not. A “normal” linebreak can be achieved using the combination “Shift+Enter” anyway
If turned on the editor acts like a messenger widget e.g. if one hits the Enter key the current content gets outputted (via a DataEvent) and the editor clears his content
Function to use in postprocessing html. See getHtml() and __getHtml().
